channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @eddyportnoy So is Israel going to supply them with Waze, if not means?
@venetianblonde @bobdylan New recordings? Or new disks from old masters?
@zackamenetz Is there anything more Meta?

@EricJGreenberg1 @YKleinHalevi @elonmusk Eric, Yossi: We might consider that Israel is happy to align with a dictatorial USA like it has aligned like dictators elsewhere before.
@EricJGreenberg1 @YKleinHalevi @elonmusk And of course, if things get bad enough here my daughter who just got her teudat zehut might be joined by her siblings. So that would be an Israeli win-win.
@YKleinHalevi @elonmusk Looking forward to getting oven images in my replies once again.

This is the present Republicans want. The question is why. https://t.co/jZzN7jjpFh
Might want to inquire about Murdoch and McConnell’s ties to China, for starter.
Or perhaps it’s their links to the barbaric religion of Christianity, which practiced human sacrifice into the 19th century and still promoted ritualized cannibalism.
@typolad https://t.co/1jVreuGCDV
Sad to see a country that doesn’t prioritize its residents meeting Jesus as soon as possible. https://t.co/99bORTN1Wo

@joshtpm One thing I’ve seen little talk about is how Twitter is just so *bad* for small advertisers compared to FB. I can’t say any of my FB ad spending delivered. But it was easy to spend the money. Twitter, much less so.
Trumpist Republicans evidently stopping AIPAC from endorsing non-Trumpist Republicans despite their support for Israel. https://t.co/HVGyxWVdBZ
@rmneiss Cue the elegies for the “vital moderate middle.”
@onthemainline @ShammaBoyarin Included in The Last Temptation of Timothy Archer, PKD’s final novel, about Bishop Pike who is an amazing story in his own right.

Ooops. When you replace librarians with algorithms, it's much easier to publish antisemitic lies. Funny how that works. https://t.co/B0KW1WoD5P
@kampeas might find this interesting.
@nonstandardrep Could happen to anyone.
The mascot the War on Passover needs has been here all along. https://t.co/2zASH3sbQY
@melnickjeffrey1 Amazing little known Dylan epic. https://t.co/8HCocYOHU3
@shaisecunda What class is this? And have you seen the new Hebrew anthology of the Beats?
@trekonomics When are the legislative elections?

@ankahajkova @OtherJayGeller Also: All the covers look like Photoshop montages rather than original illustration. Which means your titular girl has to be available on https://t.co/403NCrVD9X or your preferred source for stock photography. Which probably don’t have that many photos of girls in 1940s garb.
@ankahajkova @OtherJayGeller And if they do have multiples, which girl will seem *most* 1940s to you and the editor? Why, the one you once saw on another Holocaust book.

@bernstein_judah Of course, as befits someone who affiliated with the putschist Claremont Institute, he ignores the difference between a university holding its employees to a different standard than its independent student groups.
@ShammaBoyarin The Hertz Chumash was full of them. Sadly, it was also full of ethical admonitions, so had to be replaced following the election of Ronald Reagan.
@DrZackaryBerger He says what people with money want to hear. Always a sure path to success.
@EricaWarner16 I'd like to see his stooping to signing books in a supermarket as a sign that the wicked can get punished in this life too.
@AlderCheems @egavactip Looks like a ZIMA knockoff. Probably made by the folks behind RC Cola. Not there’s anything wrong with that.
